content: The Da Vinci kickoff, which Formulary is part of, is happening now at https://global.gotomeeting.com/join/459871733
oh shucks, in a staff meeting. will it be recorded?

Unfortunately, I don't think so. However, I can fill you in on what happened. Basically, each of the track leads gave a brief overview and covered the goals of each track. The goals of the Plan-Net track is to give participants more familiarity with the FHIR Implementation and help them build solutions.

ok, thanks @Dave Hill ! Well, having dug quite deep into the spec, I am pretty sure we are only interested in the picture of modeling org, network, national provider found here https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/davinci-pdex-plan-net/index.html (so I think I am in the right track). What are next steps on this track? How many people in this track?
There was another person who was interested in participating on the Da Vinci call and will probably be in the kickoff meeting tomorrow at 10:30am EDT.
Next steps depend on what you want to do. If you are building a client, you can test it against our server. If you have a server, you get test it against our client. The more players, the merrier!
ok, so we basically pick up tomorrow at 10:30EDT and do we hop on a zoom or just post questions here?
Saul Kravitz or I will plan to be on the Zoom meeting at 9am tomorrow.
Awesome, thanks @Dave Hill ! (I am a bit sick right now so going to rest then hit the ground running tomorrow)
Great idea! Rest is good! Hope you feel better tomorrow!
Can someone remind me which wiki page had the zoom links? Or just share the zoom link here?

Never mind, found it from the main page (not on the track page): https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/2020-05+Zoom+Info+for+Each+Track
So this one is https://zoom.us/j/4316897849

@Saul Kravitz Sync-ups are scheduled to start soon based on this schedule - https://confluence.hl7.org/display/DVP/HL7+Virtual+Connectathon+-+May+2020. Please have your sync-up and review activities from today and identify next steps. We have folks jumping around to multiple tracks, so they will use this opportunity to survey what's been happening in each track. Thanks!!
